data.title: Excellent
data.text: Here for a late breakfast with a group of 8.  Wonderful food, atmosphere, and service.  Every dish was huge, delicious, and enjoyed by our party.  The red velvet pancakes and "eggs in purgatory" were some of our group's favorite items on the menu. Perreca's is on my MUST list every trip to Schenectady.

data.title: 3 1/2 stars
data.text:
I've been to More Pereccas a number of times; most recently Nov 2016.  It's the people who make this one of my favorite restaurants.  Everyone is always so friendly and entertaining, it's like going to your favorite Aunt's house for comfort food and fun.  

The food and coffee are predictably good with some very nice daily specials and I think the prices are fair. 

All in all a good place to join friends for dinner.

data.title: That's Italian
data.text: I recently moved back to Schenectady after being away for a decade and was pleasantly surprised by my favorite bakery now in the restaurant business.  A friend and I decided to go for a late lunch, mid-week (wednesday).    I arrived first and was greeted  promptly and pleasantly.  A young man offered to seat me and bring me a drink.   Once my friend arrived, we were given time to get a drink, peruse the menu.   Sandwiches were ordered, conversation pursued.   The chicken parm with sweet potato fries was my choice and enjoyed very much.  My companion enjoyed the soup of the day, pumpkin, and a grilled chicken panini.   She enjoyed her sandwich and soup, too.  Price was moderate and since we went later in the afternoon, there were no crowds to bother us.

data.title: Was expecting more
data.text: Was here for brunch, a LONG wait since it was family weekend at Union College and we didn't have a reservation. Food was OK, portions huge (which seems to be how "good" is defined in these parts), service was good. An OK place to go if you're here, but not to make a detour for. Coffee was meh. Would like to try Perreca's Bakery, but it is closed on Sundays.

data.title: Food could be better
data.text: This restaurant has a nice space, nice atmosphere, good  prices on quality wine but  with the food they  seem to have taken the easy way out  piling on lots of  calories with oil and buttter..They could  use  a refurbishing in the kitchen.

data.title: Great for brunch
data.text: This was our 2nd family visit to enjoy the fresh, hearty, well prepared dishes. Can get crowded but worth the wait!  Breads and pastries are to die for.  Good value. Everyone left full and happy!

data.title: Yawner
data.text: Kind of a disappointment. The original Perreca's is a great place, but the portions at More Perreca's are a bit skimpy, and also  inconsistent.

data.title: Perreca's Bread, need I Say More?
data.text:
No matter what you ordered, the bread steals the show.  The service is fast and reliable and the selections are great.  Give it a try and find a good place to go to be welcomed warmly.
We will

data.title: next to the bakery
data.text: Next door to historic Perreca's and the delicious baked goods available there, More Perreca's is one of our favorite places to go for a great meal. The food is wonderful and reasonably priced. The neighborhood feel adds to the relaxing atmosphere.

data.title: Creative and delicious
data.text: Love eating here! The service was perfect, really attentive and fast. The eggs is pergatory are delicious. This time I had the egg frittata with fontinella cheese with potatoes that were sweet potatoes and white. We also ordered the red velvet pancakes. Everything was great. Menu is really creative. The people next to us ordered the "reason to live"it's stuffed French toast with bananas and some other stuff that looked great and they said it was great. Can't visit Union College without eating here. (Save room for dessert, or bring it home)

data.title: In our rotation
data.text: It was the first time for me. I had the fritatta. It was great. I will definitely be back. Service was fast and friendly.  I got dessert to go for me and my daughter. It was delicious.

data.title: Great bread, great tomato pie/pizza but the restaurant is above and beyond
data.text:
After eating at a lousy restaurant earlier in the week I had to go with hopes of go back to where it has always been good....Perreca's.  Final a place that has a great ambiance which is not going for the fancy drinks and hip atmosphere.  Their Veal Sorrento and Ziti with Vodka Red/Cream Sauce is the best I have had anywhere.  You can't go wrong going here.  And the staff is TOP NOTCH.  Even the chef comes to each table to ask how the meals are.
Calamari is excellent.
This place makes you feel right at home.
You can eat outside or inside and the inside is of great design.

data.title: Need to Try it Again to Truly Decide....
data.text: We were in the area and happened to find More Perreca's on a Sunday afternoon. We were eating a late lunch and decided to give it a try. It was a small restaurant with an open kitchen area - the gentleman who seated us was very friendly (Rob?). Our server (Carol?) was great - she was hustling the whole time we were there and still never dropped the ball with our table at all. We were initially given dinner menus and asked if they had a lunch menu. Not being from the area, we weren't familiar with the changeover from Lunch to Dinner at 3pm. But it was 2:45pm and we were given lunch menus. It seemed that the general manager may not have agreed with the change in our menu, but were allowed to order from it. We ended up ordering the fried calamari from the dinner menu and the HOT ITALIAN MIX Panini and the CAPPICOLO & MELTED PROVOLONE TOMATO PIE PANINI from the lunch menu. We were seated beside the open kitchen area and could hear the staff exchanges throughout the meal, which wasn't necessary problematic for us. Except when our waitress inquired about the status of our calamari, the manager told her that when it was ready she'd see it in the window. It seemed sort of a harsh delivery to us - especially given that her service had been great! That's not to say that the General Manager, Chris, didn't also display some initiative and good service himself. He pitched in to help expedite and serve food - interacted with the customers directly and kept things moving.  The food was truly outstanding. Nothing to complain about there. The bathrooms were very clean. The atmosphere was friendly overall. If we had just not heard some of the interactions from the kitchen and not had the debate about lunch vs. dinner menus and time, it would have been an easy EXCELLENT review. We walked about full and with positive feelings but will need to visit again to see if our experience was a fluke or a pattern.

data.title: Yummy Italian restaurant!
data.text: Located next door to its bakery, this restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. I've had their pizza and their eggplant Parmesan. Both excellent. It has live music at least one night a week.

data.title: A favorite weekend dining place
data.text: I love the COAL FIRED PERSONAL PIZZA and the home made bread is the best. Steak sandwich is tender and flavorful and of course the chicken parmesan is wonderful.

data.title: Best place for Eggs from Purgatory! Curious?
data.text: Hard to go wrong here when the bread is baked next door and it's the best bread in the county! Staff is very pleasant, service is quick and the food is down home good.  My dad had a chicken/avocado panini which was great.  Love going there!  Got some meatballs to go which were great, too!

data.title: Perreca's Rules!
data.text: The next door bakery expanded into an eatery which is very good. We have had brunch, breakfast and lunch here many times this past year. Love the small tables and booths, the food is very fresh, and the location with a parking lot in the back is along our way. Coffee is never ending and the service is excellent with very clean bathrooms available. Never feel they are rushing you either. A rarity nowadays.

data.title: Real Italian food
data.text: We love the small friendly feeling of this place. The black vinyl banquettes and black and white tile make you feel like you're in Little Italy. Sometimes there is accordion music. The seafood and specials are always good. The staff is very friendly, and of course, the famous bread is baked next door. Good inexpensive wine selection. Great for before a show or Union hockey game. Also great breakfast with eggs in purgatory!

data.title: Ok breakfast option
data.text: Waitress was extremely attentive, although the place was almost empty at 7:30am. Food was good between the breakfast panini and pancakes, with dinner-sized sausage made right there in Schenectady.  White and sweet potato home fries were a good touch. However something seemed to be missing - maybe they could offer rolls similar to the wonderful bread made next door.

data.title: They have gone downhill
data.text: Went there Sunday, 5/22/16. Very disappointed, ordered lunch special (ziti and meatballs), wife ordered stuffed blueberry french toast.To be fair, they warned us they were running behind due to power loss. No problem, over an hour later food arrived the french toast was pretty sad and my food turned out to be linguini and meatballs (must have been sitting around a while as only warm). Not even bread and great bakery attached.  Will not be going back which is a shame as used to eat there often when worked down the street. Service was also very poor.
